formElement.label: Configuration name:
formElement.documentation: Name of the configuration to be used. URL and credentials are retrieved from the given configuration. To view or create a new configuration, go to the Administration -> Plugins tab, and select 'Configure' action for @PLUGIN_KEY@ plugin.
formElement.htmlDocumentation:
Name of the configuration to be used. URL and credentials are retrieved from the given configuration.
A Configuration defines connection details and can be created by going to plugin configuration page.

formElement.label: JNDI Names:
formElement.documentation: Format: comma separated JNDI names (do not use whitespaces). The list of JNDI names the queue will be bound to. For example: 'java:jboss/exported/jms/queue/test,java:jboss/exported/jms/queue/test2'

formElement.label: Profile:
formElement.documentation: Required for Domain, will be ignored for Standalone. Name of profile in Domain where queue should be created or updated (in case of need). For example: 'full', 'full-ha'

formElement.label: Durable:
formElement.documentation: NOTE: This parameter will be considered only for create scenario and will be ignored for update scenario. Whether the queue to be created is durable or not. Default is false (unchecked) - non durable.

formElement.label: Message Selector:
formElement.documentation: NOTE: This parameter will be considered only for create scenario and will be ignored for update scenario. JMS message selector the queue will have. Only messages that match the selector will be added to the queue. For example: color='red'

formElement.label: Additional Options:
formElement.documentation: NOTE: This parameter will be considered only for create scenario and will be ignored for update scenario. The 'Additional options' string will be concatenated to already generated command line for creating queue. For example: '--legacy-entries=java:jboss/exported/jms/queue/legacy1,java:jboss/exported/jms/queue/legacy2'
